lexUnit.name: peer.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: look with difficulty or concentration.

sentence.text: The woman peered where she pointed , out into the night .
Suddenly I found myself in hospital clinics being peered at by hundreds of doctors , all making interested sounding noises and saying long biological words .
Shiona peered across at him .
Excitedly he peered inside ,
She had watched him go amongst the caskets , then lift one of the lids , peering inside .
I peered inside -- but I could n't see Radish .
I was walking round the vehicle , peering underneath to check the state of the tyres and the exhaust line .
Omally peered furtively about the bar and gestured the barman closer .
` Where are we ? " he asked , peering about him .
She hurried to the pond and peered among the reeds to see if her friend was visible .
Our horses slowed to a trot , a walk , as we peered around us in the mist .
She peered at the Christmas cactus she had bought for Alan and decided it looked distinctly sorry for itself .
The green eyes peered at Erika .
Mrs Jones lingered frequently to peer at the faces .
Lýonie peered at her .
Another man sat alone at the table next to them , peering at a magazine .
He peered at the piece of paper .
Tug sat down where the Woman pointed , but Doyle began to walk round the room , peering at the table from all angles .
Sometimes she stopped for hours to gaze across the sea , to peer between rocks , to watch an osprey ride the thermals .
The foreman was behind them peering between their shoulders , and there was a sniff of impatience .
An Arab woman , a Palestinian , was peering from the upper balcony .
On the second stairwell she could see the landlady peering from the doorway of the writer 's room , pink with anger .
It was very easy to imagine eyes peering from the gloom , or strange beings creeping along the path behind them .
He reminded Harry , in his build , expression and asthmatic wheeze , of a bulldog peering ill-humouredly from his kennel .
The body of the ark was green , with painted heads of animals peering from the portholes .
He peered from the screen .
Loretta drove slowly , peering from side to side for a glimpse of the Red House .
The elderly Chas Varley was peering in some confusion at an arc of screens which pulsed with read-outs and rippling waveforms .
The kettle switched itself off , and she peered in a cupboard for a rarely used teatray .
The Doctor peered in the direction she had indicated .
By peering hard in the same direction , I could just make out the faint flicker of a distant plane .
He strolled up the long arcade , pausing frequently to peer in shop windows at the expensive goodies .
Willie peered in the window and wiped away the mist his breath was making on the glass .
Juliet peered into her fruit juice .
His mother was applying blue eyeshadow with a brush , drawing down her eyelids and peering into the mirror .
Robyn flicked open her eyes and peered into the night .
She peered past him .
He eyed the sword-point warily before peering past it to the body on the floor .
I thought she might be under the front part of the colonnade , and peered cautiously round the corner .
The door opened suddenly and Rachel 's coy face peered round it .
Climb the hill and enter the echoing fifteenth-century Gothic church to peer through glass panels at the medieval foundations .
She peered anxiously through the glass doors into the reception area .
He peered toward her .
Yanto crouched down and peered under the wagon .
Diana peers out of a plane window
Intrigued , he moved forward on to the balcony and peered down cautiously .
I tried to peer in but it was getting too dark to see properly .
The moon peering in helped her to see and there was no need to switch on the light .
He peered over the top .
The Deputy Director of Crisis Relocation peered sternly over his spectacles .
Anxiously she peered in among the trees .
Human eyes peered out through the empty sockets of beasts .
The hedgehog peered up at the dog .
Two small faces peered up at him .
